page.title: 14Memories of Witton-le-Wear
page.content: {Written by Miss Ramshaw,who has lived {in the village for over seventy years. The Vicar at that time,1914,was the Rev.James Hodgson,who was responsible for the present church building. Although almost 90 years old,his hearing was good and he did not need spectacles.The Vicarage (on the same site as the present one) was a low whitewashed building.A flight of steps led down to the front door, and I remember a pump in the middle of the kitchen floor from which water was drawn.There were also two pumps in the village,one on the green and one near the Sunday School.this building had been the Day School in the early part of the 19th century. The Sunday School was supervised by Miss Mary Jopling for many years,Mr Hodgson refusing to have anything to do with it.
